Description: Stamped handle of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora; rectangular stamp with a Greek inscription and wreath symbol.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Old Speech Room Gallery and Museum, Harrow School. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Probably from same die as BM GR2011,5003.177. Name, Amyntas. A man called Amyntas was according to Budge the commander of a Rhodian squadron during the siege of Rhodes in 304 BC. Budge, E.A.W. 1887, Catalogue of the Egyptian antiquities from the collection of the late Sir Gardner Wilkinson, Harrow School Museum, Harrow, 85.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.0790)
